physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient presented with intermittent erythema and irritation of the left lower eyelid. Examination revealed a central erythematous plaque reaching the lid margin. There was also a 20 mm erythematous, scaly plaque with areas of hyperkeratosis, atrophy, and scarring, associated with telangiectasia and surrounding erythema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 3 months follow-up, the patient was asymptomatic on hydroxychloroquine without further recurrence.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Examination revealed a 14 mm erythematous, scaly plaque on the lateral half of the right lower lid associated with madarosis, telangiectasia, and mild tarsal conjunctival injection.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Histopathology was consistent with DLE, with minimal response to intralesional triamcinolone and no response to topical tacrolimus. The patient responded well to hydroxychloroquine 200 mg once daily and remains in remission at 1 year post-treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Examination demonstrated an erythematous plaque along the medial aspect of the right lower eyelid margin with telangiectasia, and a 25 mm erythematous, scaly plaque at the medial aspect of the left cheek.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially treated for posterior blepharitis, the lesions became enlarged and more irritable. At 2 months follow-up, showed worsening with an erythematous scaly plaque along the eyelid margins extending to the upper lid.
